title: hosted environment creation guide
description:
General information

Hosted server - server which belongs to sippysoft and selling on the per-environment basis to the new hosted customers.

If sales department ask support team to create new environment for some new hosted client then please follow to the instruction below.

Required information before adding

Please make sure that you receive all required information from sales about new environment:

  • How much channels we need to setup (Max CPS/Max Channel);
  • Which modules should be included;
  • Email address of new customer (for further notification that his system has been provisioning);
  • Preferred location (dallas, seattle or Italy);

Prepare hosted environment

Please start environment preparation after you received all required information from sales.

Before adding new environment to some hosted server please check the following things:

  • General server load;
  • If it is enough free space on server for the new environment;
  • If it is enough DB connections for the new environment: 
psql -U pgsql template1 -c "SELECT COUNT(*), datname FROM pg_stat_activity group by 2 order by 1;"

 count |  datname
-------+-----------
     1 | template1
    42 | sippy15
    42 | sippy14
    49 | sippy3
    51 | sippy11
    51 | sippy16
    52 | sippy6
    67 | sippy
    72 | sippy13

!!! Please note, Should be less than 750-800 connections, because after adding you can receive "low database connections" issue in the peak time.

DB limit = 900 connections(after this threshold you will receive "Low database connections").

Choose IP for the new environment

Sometimes you can choose IP from the list of available:

But please check if the new IP is not static. It should be portable!!!

If there is no available IPs in the list, then you can choose one from "IP manager list"(see image above) on the softlayer. But please make sure that new IP from the same subnet that other IPs on the hosted server.

If all is ok then please add IP to the server and add note in the softlayer whom belongs this IP.

Add environment and make the BFT test

After adding IP to the server you can assign it to the new environment and add required modules.

If all was done you can start environment and make the basic functionality test: 

cd /home/ssp/scripts/support_tools
sudo cvs -d your_login@cvsro.sippysoft.com:/home/ncvs up bft.py

sudo ./bft.py -c ENV

-c - create test acc, vendor, tariff etc. -d - delete all configs. ENV - should be specified the value of the required environment.

username: sippy_support_bft@IP

password: sippy321

make call on number 16047342679

Notify customer that his system has been prepared

Dear Customer,

We are happy to welcome you as a new customer! Your system has been
provisioned, and ready for you to log in using the credentials below:

https://
Username: ssp-root
Password: ssp-root

Our technical support team is available via email 24/7; please contact them at
support@sippysoft.com to schedule a training or to open a ticket/report an
issue. You may also find the following resources useful:
http://docs.sippysoft.com

You are currently the designated administrator for this system, which means we will
only take direction from you. If you wish to add additional people as designated administrator
please send us their email address, phone number and full name by replying to this email.

In case you have ordered an additional webphone module then we need ask you to provide 
us an additional information about the following:
Are you going to use IP address or DNS name to access the softswitch's web interface?
Right now it's set to IP address only, please let us know if you plan to add DNS name any time soon.
We need to know it, since for protection reasons. Webphone applet is bound to a specific IPs/DNS names 
and so if you change or add any of it later we will have to re-issue the applet.

Thank you for choosing Sippy Software!

Ask Billing to add this server to CRM and to send you an installation_id

About VPN module

If you add VPN module then please don't forget to prepare it for customer.

Customer email addresses

Please don't forget to add new company to the freshdesk and assign email addresses which are connected with this company.

title: hosted env. deletion procedure
description:
General information

If sales department asks support team to delete some hosted environment then please follow to the instruction below.

Which information support should have before deleting

  • IP of the environment which should be deleted;

  • Should we notify customer (who rent an environment) about deleting or not;
  • Ask billing department to move customers record to the obsolete clients in the CRM right away;

Steps for environment deleting

1) Login to the softlayer and delete notes about company name according to the necessary address.

See example where it should be deleted:

2) Login to the root env of hosted server and find the required IP which should be deleted.

3) Stop environment.

4) Click delete.

5) Notify billing @ sippysoft.com that it was done and add sales to CC.
